str2: And, even, also, namely.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First-born, eldest. From protos and the alternate of tikto; first-born.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Present participle of archo; a first.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

str2: A primary verb; to 'loosen'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From hamartano; a sin.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
